channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report E-2023100239
item.description:
Report E-2023100239

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-23
  • City: Hyattsville
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 9/23/2023 at 0139 hours a 16 rail car and 1 locomotive derailed in Hyattsville, Maryland at BAA 33.4 milepost at the Baltimore Avenue crossing intersecting Emerson Street. UTLX910325 (residue UN2370 Hexene) and UTLX91084 (residue UN1075 liquefied petroleum gas) derailed on their side with no leaks. 14 closed hopper cars with polyurethane pellets derailed with various orientations and varying levels of leaked pellets. The shipper, Shell Chemical, was notified via CHEMTREC (report 2023-0923-00020). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, as well as (2) Managers of Hazardous Materials from CSX, were dispatched to the scene to assess the damaged hazardous material tank cars, contain leaked pellets, and remediate a minor fuel release from the derailed locomotive. The crossing at Baltimore Avenue and Emerson Street were closed for approximately 7 days as a result of the derailment.

item.title: Report E-2023100652
item.description:
Report E-2023100652

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-30
  • City: ELKRIDGE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When the doors of the trailer were opened to unload the enclosed freight it was observed that the floor of the trailer was wet. Further investigation revealed that a drum had been crushed we are assuming at the time it was loaded into trailer contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and placed into a recovery container as was the crushed drum.

item.title: Report X-2023091073
item.description:
Report X-2023091073

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: BELTSVILLE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I found damaged package in damage hazmat cage. I repacked in a salvage drum and completed the required reports. DescribePack: The container was leaking from a loose cap. About 1 pint of content spilled. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package was placed in a tub and taken to the damage hazmat cage.
